page.title: 02Achahoish Church
page.content: Achahoish Church is situated on the Ellary road. It is surrounded by trees and an old stone wall, and has a burn flowing past it. It is part of the parish of South Knapdale, founded in 1734, so it celebrated its 250th anniversary in 1984 with a special service. The church itself is small and made of stone with a slated roof. It has a tower leading to a gallery inside the church but this is now unsafe. Inside, the seating is on wooden benches. The baptismal font came from St. Columba's Cave which is situated further along the Ellary road. Extensive renovations took place in 1984, and public worship takes place there every second Sunday.
